Title: Venture Global granted FERC approval to introduce hazardous liquids to Plaquemines LNG
Description: US LNG project developer Venture Global received approval from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to introduce hazardous fluids to the gas turbine generator 1 of its 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana, signalling of the facility’s imminent start-up.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks three September LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy three cargoes for delivery in September to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in the southern province of Rayong. The tender closes on Jul. 15
Author: CK

Title: German association forecasts empty gas stocks in case of a cold winter
Description: German gas storage system operators’ association INES foresees stocks ending the upcoming winter at comfortable levels in case of a mild to normal winter and does not exclude them ending empty if the winter is cold.
Author: JS

Title: Summit LNG arrives in Bangladesh to resume LNG import operations after repairs
Description: The 138,000 m3 Summit LNG floating storage regasification unit arrived in Bangladesh today after a five-day journey from Singapore and is expected to resume LNG import operations.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside agrees 10-year LNG deal with CPC until 2034; potential for a further 10-year supply
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside will supply Taiwan's state-owned CPC with 6 million tons (mt) of LNG over 10 years through a term supply agreement that begins this month.
Author: CK
